reason: This has progressed *way* beyond the initial PR, and it no longer even uses a Forest.  So I'm declining this, as some development work that's on going requires me to push up to my fork, which updates the (now not quite relevant) PR, causing tests, emails, blah blah.  It will be reiussed, although probably not by me, when it's in a much better state.
description:
This is all the work I did last fall on forest of octrees.  As it stands, it may work almost, perhaps even slightly, but probably not, and has lots of issues.

Additionally, I think I need to redo it in many ways to make it work the way I think it ought to, rather than the way I implemented it then.  I've rebased it so that the DAG isn't too horrifying.

As it stands, it does some simple stuff like switch how coordinates are read, and change how we store and create particle octrees, but it needs to go further.  A few ideas I've been toying with:

 * Get rid of the ParticleForests object, and instead switch to bitpacked arrays.  This will move all the detection into the data file, rather than a master index.  It will be easier to manage the size as well.
 * More aggressively refactor the particle IO code to use all yields for coordinates, and make these iterations be over the data files rather than the chunks.  This has been started in the PR code.
 * Add the ability to do growth of the bitarrays; this will be key for any type of smoothing, as we will need to get neighbor particles from other files.

Anyway, there's lots more, but I wanted to open this just to show where it is right now.  Or rather, where it was last November.

UPDATE 1: With this, projections and whatnot mostly work for deposition fields.  I'm getting a weird interplay between `_initialize_coarse_index` and the `domain_dimensions` which I should be able to fix.  Making this projection takes ~90 seconds on a 512file/1024^3 gadget dataset, with peak memory usage of 1.7 gigabytes.  (I think that can come down considerably.)  Right now, smoothing doesn't do neighboring zones, so it will only work sporadically, but that can be addressed.

![f1.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/BXbAb/images/3011589146-f1.png)
![f2.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/BXbAb/images/494456416-f2.png)
![f3.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/BXbAb/images/3437923053-f3.png)
title: [WIP] Forest of octrees

content.raw: Also, review on this is welcomed, but not necessary.
content.html: Also, review on this is welcomed, but not necessary.
